newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - COFFEE COULD MOVE LOWER, CHALLENGE SUPPORT.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - COFFEE COULD MOVE LOWER, CHALLENGE SUPPORT.

text.p: SEPT Close * Support * Resist * RSI14 * MA10 * MA30
Robusta coffee futures were expected to resume their downward trend on Wednesday after selling waves dragged both the London and New York markets sharply lower, traders said on Wednesday.
The London market was called to open between $20 and $30 lower than Tuesday's close.
London's September contract dived through psychological support at $1,600 a tonne and was expected to remain weak as long as the nearby September/November spread was at a discount, traders said.
Initial support was pegged at last month's reaction low of $1,477. But if that failed September was likely to target the lower end of a chart gap at $1,368.
"Coffee looks fairly weak now," said Elli Gifford, an independent technical analyst.
Bearish fundamentals had also weighed on sentiment as concerns eased about supply tightness.
Many industry sources expected the Green Coffee Association to show an build in green coffee stowed in U.S. warehouses during July.
Most early estimates looked for an increase over June levels of 50,000 to 100,000 60-kg bags.
